parametrized_description: A bodybuilder purchases two types of meals: MealA and MealB. Each MealA contains ProteinTurkey amount of protein, CarbsTurkey amount of carbohydrates, and FatTurkey amount of fat. Each MealB contains ProteinTuna amount of protein, CarbsTuna amount of carbohydrates, and FatTuna amount of fat. The bodybuilder aims to obtain at least MinProtein total protein and at least MinCarbs total carbohydrates. Additionally, no more than MaxTurkeyFraction fraction of the total meals can be MealA. The objective is to minimize the total fat intake.

ProteinTurkey.description: Amount of protein in one turkey dinner

CarbsTurkey.description: Amount of carbohydrates in one turkey dinner

FatTurkey.description: Amount of fat in one turkey dinner

ProteinTuna.description: Amount of protein in one tuna salad sandwich

CarbsTuna.description: Amount of carbohydrates in one tuna salad sandwich

FatTuna.description: Amount of fat in one tuna salad sandwich

MaxTurkeyFraction.description: Maximum fraction of meals that can be turkey dinners

QuantityTuna.description: The number of tuna salad sandwiches

constraints.description: The total protein from MealA and MealB must be at least MinProtein.
The total carbohydrates from MealA and MealB must be at least MinCarbs.
No more than MaxTurkeyFraction fraction of the total meals can be MealA.
